itemDescription: Welsh rugby union and rugby league footballer

wikipedia_page.main: Ian Stuart Gallacher (22 May 1946 – 19 October 2014) was a Welsh dual-code international rugby union, and professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1960s and 1970s.

response: More recent discussions have punted merging western sides Scarlets and Ospreys, with the Llanelli and Swansea teams either sharing grounds or moving fully. Scarlets however opposed such a merger with Ospreys back in 2003, with the late Stuart Gallacher famously opposed to any arrangement which would have ended the Scarlets name.
* Ian Stuart Gallacher, Llanelli, Wales Youth, Wales, Bradford Northern,R.L.
| 75. || Stuart Gallacher || RU Test v France || 1970 || Cardiff || RL Test v New Zealand || 2 Nov 1975 || Swansea || Forward

In June 1970 Butler, along with club-mate Stuart Gallacher switched to professional rugby league, joining Bradford Northern. This act severed his ties with rugby union and he never played the sport again.
**Stuart Gallacher, 68, rugby player (Wales national union and league teams) and executive.
*Stuart Gallacher, 68, Welsh rugby player (national union and league teams) and executive.Stuart Gallacher: Former Regional Rugby Wales boss dies, aged 68
